title: Ticket #3922: Stderr from job hooks run by starter should end up in log files
description:
If a job hook run by the startd (eg *_HOOK_FETCH_WORK) outputs to stderr, the message will be put in the START_LOG (see /src/condor_startd.V6 in FetchClient::hookExited; look for "Warning, hook").

If a job hook run by the starter (eg *_HOOK_PREPARE_JOB) outputs to stderr, the message is discarded. (see /src/condor_starter.V6.1/StarterHookMgr.cpp, look for HookPrepareJobClient::hookExited and HookPrepareJobClient::hookExited). This makes debugging a hook harder; a hook writer must manage their own log file of some sort. This should be changed to behave like the startd case: copy the hook's stderr into STARTER_LOG.
